title: Kashmiri leaders underscore importance of “Accession to Pakistan Resolution”
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 20 (APP):The Friends of Kashmir International (FoK) on Saturday underscored importance of the resolution of “accession to Pakistan” passed by the Kashmiris 77 years ago on July 19 through which they associated their political future with Pakistan.
The FoK organised an online webinar on X space formerly Twitter on the occasion of “Pakistan Accession Day” where Ghazala Habib, Chairperson of Friends of Kashmir International, Deputy Chairman and Abdul Hameed Lone, Social Worker Sadia Sattar, Atiqul Rasool of Islamabad Bar Council, Warda Hashmi and others participated in it.
During the webinar, Ghazala Habib, Abdul Hameed Lone and other speakers highlighted the importance of the resolution of “accession to Pakistan” passed by the Kashmiris 77 years ago and said that the Kashmiri leadership had approved this resolution about a month before the creation of Pakistan, however, the cruel Indian leadership strangled the wishes, hopes and aspirations of the Kashmiris by landing the army in Jammu and Kashmir and seized it.
The speakers said that Kashmiris are making great sacrifices against the illegal occupation of India, Indian atrocities could not destroy their spirit of freedom and love for Pakistan and they are determined to continue their struggle till the completion of the great mission of the martyrs.
They said that despite the difficulties and problems, Pakistan is conveying the voice of Kashmiris to the world forums, Pakistan is a strong advocate of the right of self-determination of Kashmiris.
The speakers of the webinar said, “history is a witness that nothing but defeat and humiliation has come at the hands of oppressive and oppressive forces, India will also have to surrender to the voice of Kashmiris one day and give them freedom.”
